alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clay; Fillmore; Greeley; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Merrick; Nance; Nuckolls; Polk; Sherman; Thayer; Valley; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 6:06PM CST until January 19 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory through early Friday morning, residual blowing and drifting snow, as all falling snow has ended. North-northwest winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 MPH this evening, but gradually becoming lighter overnight into Friday morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory this evening into Friday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -25 expected. For the Wind Chill Advisory for Friday evening into Saturday morning, very cold wind chills as low as -15 to -25 again expected, although wind speeds will only be around 10 MPH or less. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Friday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST Friday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
